design_row.description: Real-time stock trading interface with portfolio management

findings.message: WebSocket origin validation can be bypassed. Market data WebSocket accepts connections from any origin, allowing unauthorized access to real-time trading data.

message.text: WebSocket origin validation can be bypassed. Market data WebSocket accepts connections from any origin, allowing unauthorized access to real-time trading data.

raw.summary: Web3.js vulnerable to prototype pollution allowing attackers to manipulate blockchain transaction parameters.
Socket.io authentication bypass allows unauthorized WebSocket connections to real-time market data streams.

design_row.description: High-frequency trading order execution and routing to exchanges

findings.message: Race condition in order execution engine. Multiple concurrent orders can be processed without proper locking, leading to double-spending or incorrect portfolio balances.

message.text: Race condition in order execution engine. Multiple concurrent orders can be processed without proper locking, leading to double-spending or incorrect portfolio balances.

findings.message: Timing attack vulnerability in authentication. String comparison for API keys is not constant-time, allowing attackers to brute force keys character by character.

message.text: Timing attack vulnerability in authentication. String comparison for API keys is not constant-time, allowing attackers to brute force keys character by character.

findings.message: Integer overflow in portfolio valuation calculation. Large position sizes can cause arithmetic overflow leading to incorrect P&L calculations.

message.text: Integer overflow in portfolio valuation calculation. Large position sizes can cause arithmetic overflow leading to incorrect P&L calculations.

findings.message: Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) in portfolio API. Users can access other users' portfolios by manipulating account_id parameter.

message.text: Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) in portfolio API. Users can access other users' portfolios by manipulating account_id parameter.

findings.message: XML External Entity (XXE) injection in SEC filing parser. XML parser processes external entities without validation.

message.text: XML External Entity (XXE) injection in SEC filing parser. XML parser processes external entities without validation.

findings.message: Hardcoded Plaid API secret in KYC verification service. Secret should be stored in environment variables or secrets manager.

findings.message: Prototype pollution vulnerability in order validation. Unsafe object merge allows attackers to inject properties into Object.prototype.

message.text: Prototype pollution vulnerability in order validation. Unsafe object merge allows attackers to inject properties into Object.prototype.

findings.message: Regular expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) in account number validation. Complex regex with nested quantifiers can cause exponential backtracking.

findings.message: No rate limiting on order submission endpoint. Allows attackers to flood the system with orders causing denial of service.

raw.summary: Redis client vulnerable to command injection via unsanitized cache keys.

non_cve_findings.message: Race condition in order execution engine. Multiple concurrent orders can be processed without proper locking, leading to double-spending or incorrect portfolio balances.
Timing attack vulnerability in authentication. String comparison for API keys is not constant-time, allowing attackers to brute force keys character by character.
Integer overflow in portfolio valuation calculation. Large position sizes can cause arithmetic overflow leading to incorrect P&L calculations.
WebSocket origin validation can be bypassed. Market data WebSocket accepts connections from any origin, allowing unauthorized access to real-time trading data.
Weak cryptographic key generation for blockchain wallet private keys. Uses Math.random() instead of cryptographically secure random number generator.
SQL injection in transaction history query. User-supplied account ID is concatenated directly into SQL query without parameterization.
Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) in portfolio API. Users can access other users' portfolios by manipulating account_id parameter.
XML External Entity (XXE) injection in SEC filing parser. XML parser processes external entities without validation.
Hardcoded Plaid API secret in KYC verification service. Secret should be stored in environment variables or secrets manager.
Prototype pollution vulnerability in order validation. Unsafe object merge allows attackers to inject properties into Object.prototype.

assertions.detail: CRITICAL: This vulnerability is actively exploited (KEV). Used in payment-processor and blockchain-gateway for transaction signing. Immediate patching required. Financial impact: potential unauthorized transactions worth millions.

CRITICAL: Active exploitation confirmed (KEV). Market data WebSocket is internet-facing. Unauthorized access could leak trading strategies and cause financial losses. Emergency patch scheduled for tonight.
CRITICAL: Active exploitation confirmed (KEV). Blockchain-gateway manages customer crypto wallets with millions in assets. Private key compromise = direct financial theft. IMMEDIATE ACTION REQUIRED.
HIGH PRIORITY: Functional exploit available. Used in blockchain-gateway for transaction construction. Could allow attackers to redirect crypto transfers. Upgrade scheduled for this week.
LOW PRIORITY: Code review confirms all redirect URLs are hardcoded constants. No user input in redirect logic. Upgrade planned for next maintenance window.
MEDIUM PRIORITY: Sequelize is used but preliminary code review shows only parameterized queries. Comprehensive audit in progress. Upgrade scheduled for next sprint.

properties.message: WebSocket origin validation can be bypassed. Market data WebSocket accepts connections from any origin, allowing unauthorized access to real-time trading data.
Race condition in order execution engine. Multiple concurrent orders can be processed without proper locking, leading to double-spending or incorrect portfolio balances.
Timing attack vulnerability in authentication. String comparison for API keys is not constant-time, allowing attackers to brute force keys character by character.
Integer overflow in portfolio valuation calculation. Large position sizes can cause arithmetic overflow leading to incorrect P&L calculations.
Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) in portfolio API. Users can access other users' portfolios by manipulating account_id parameter.
XML External Entity (XXE) injection in SEC filing parser. XML parser processes external entities without validation.
Hardcoded Plaid API secret in KYC verification service. Secret should be stored in environment variables or secrets manager.
Prototype pollution vulnerability in order validation. Unsafe object merge allows attackers to inject properties into Object.prototype.
Regular expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) in account number validation. Complex regex with nested quantifiers can cause exponential backtracking.
No rate limiting on order submission endpoint. Allows attackers to flood the system with orders causing denial of service.
Sensitive financial data (account balances, SSN) logged in plaintext. Violates PCI-DSS and SOC2 requirements.
SQL injection in transaction history query. User-supplied account ID is concatenated directly into SQL query without parameterization.
Weak cryptographic key generation for blockchain wallet private keys. Uses Math.random() instead of cryptographically secure random number generator.

properties.title: Ensure all system components are protected from known vulnerabilities
Run internal and external network vulnerability scans quarterly

notes: Components likely to escalate: cache, web, api, api, api

insights: Projected MTTR improvement exceeds one day

recommendations: Increase concurrency or disable heavy modules for near real-time execution
Prioritise high/critical findings queue to preserve response SLAs

enhanced_decision.summary: Consensus BLOCK at 84.5% confidence across 22 findings.
